discourse_list.title: Proposal for the avoidance of possible future sanctions

content.content: Taking into account what currently happened with USDC and tornado cash, I think it would be good to consider and evaluate the possibility of implementing some kind of regulation or blocking wallets that are found somehow laundering money with Dai or hackers who are holders of Dai so that the U.E. treasury has zero suspicion of Maker and does not sanction it in some way in the future. I know that many will not agree to do that (or at least it can no longer be done, but only copying Maker and Dai contracts and then deploying them with that update) with the decentralized product that is Dai, but a world without any kind of order or rules seems catastrophic and chaotic, on the one hand, the U. E. treasury is right, but on the other hand, that kind of control can lend itself to other kinds of injustices, so after having introduced that kind of regulatory control over circulating Dai to the Maker protocol and governance, the situation can become more complicated as one would have to be very careful not to block black Dai in innocent wallets that passed quickly between protocols. Think carefully if this is good and applicable for Maker.     Good and applicable for Maker Not good and not applicable for Maker     0 voters

USDC makes up 28.2% of your total Dai, if that 28.2% is blocked (which is very unlikely in the short term) your Dai will be worth $0.718, on the other hand, if you are not involved in illicit business why would you be worried about something like that?

Kujira at cosmos sees this it seems and are looking to fix  the problem, though I am not shilling them, only learning now. There should not need to be a justification for having a centralized or sanctions/censorship-friendly coin. Its that simple.

content.content: The value of an anon poll on a forum overrun with sockpuppets is zero.

Crypto native stablecoin was the original goal. Decentralized and censorship resistant. For me personally the decision is easy. Phase out stablecoin collateral. For me the value of Dai is that its decentralized and uncensorable and available to anyone. Ideally. I gladly give up on RWA. That Dai will even allowed to integrate with the normal economy is highly questionable. I honestly dont think that Dai will be allowed to call itself stablecoin and wont be approved by the us government. I dont think makerdao can be compliant even if they tried without completly destroying Dai and making it useless. If we start censoring and backing with US government bonds. Dai is basically like USDC plus the self mint option with crypto, doubt that will be ok with the government. But then Dai has no choice other than to comply.
